conbody.p: This manual provides detailed water-piping diagrams for typical methods of application for the water heaters. See .

The water heater can be installed with or without a separate storage tank. When used with a separate storage tank, the circulation can be either by gravity or by means of a circulating pump. When a circulating pump is used, it is important to note that the flow rate should be slow enough that there is a minimum of turbulence inside the water heater storage tank.
Adjust the flow by throttling a full-port ball valve installed in the circulating line on the outlet side of the pump. Never throttle the flow on the suction side of a pump. See .
conbody.note: In addition to the factory-installed Temperature-Pressure Relief valve (T&P valve) on the water heater, each remote-storage tank that can be installed and piped to a water-heating appliance must also have its own properly-sized, rated, and approved Temperature-Pressure Relief valve installed.
conbody.p: Call the toll-free technical-support phone number listed on the back cover of this manual for further assistance in sizing a T&P valve for remote-storage tanks.
